[date of source: March 19, 2007
Finding aid encoded by Valerie Higgins, Library/Archives, Indiana University, March 10, 2009

did.head: Summary Information
did.unittitle: Barr mss.
did.abstract: The Barr mss., 1958-1971, consists of official papers of Joseph Walker Barr, 1918-, U.S. Secretary of the Treasury.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Joseph Walker Barr, 1918-, a native of Vincennes, Indiana, and an alumnus of DePauw University and Harvard University, served as a member of the 86th Congress from Indiana, 1959-1960, as assistant to the Secretary of the Treasury, 1961-1964, as chairman of the FDIC, 1964-1965, as Under Secretary of the Treasury from April 29, 1965 to December 20, 1968, and as 79th Secretary of the Treasury until January 20, 1969.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into the following series: Memoranda, 1964-1969; Congressional Activities, 1958-1960; General Files; Speeches and Remarks, 1959-1969; Statements Before House and Senate Committees, 1965-1969; Reel to Reel Audio Tapes of Interviews on Television, 1967-1968; Press Releases, 1959-1960 and 1967-1969; and Printed Materials and Clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Barr mss., 1958-1971, consists of official papers of Joseph Walker Barr, 1918-, U.S. Secretary of the Treasury. The papers include memoranda; papers on congressional activities; general files, from Africa to White House; speeches and remarks; statements before House and Senate committees; tapes of interviews on television (some of the transcripts may be found in Speeches); press releases; printed materials; and clippings. The papers refer to legislation relating to the Asian Development Bank, campaign contributions, gold and the balance of payments, interest rates for savings and loan institutions, international development institutions, participation sales, truth-in-lending, and reports covering transition from the Johnson to the Nixon administration.

controlaccess.head: Controlled Access Terms
controlaccess.corpname: United States. Dept. of the Treasury.
controlaccess.subject: Legislators --United States.
United States --Politics and government --20th century.

controlaccess.head: Additional Access Terms
controlaccess.corpname: United States. Dept. of the Treasury.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Photocopying permitted only with the permission of the Curator of Manuscripts, Lilly Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Barr mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.
